page.title: 09Chillerton C. Primary Sch.
page.content: {Jennifer Steele writes}- About 60 children attend our School, 6 come by taxi from Gatcombe or Billingham, 38 come by School Transport or car from Rookley, the rest live in Chillerton. The school has a main Hall and Servery with two small Classrooms. School dinners are sent out from Newport. A Mobile Classroom for the youngest children stands in the playground. School begins at 8.50 a.m. and pupils work in three classes each with a two year age span. In front of the school is a blossomy garden and at the side is a field for sports. We are taken to swim to the Medina Pool and we enjoy the Music and Country Dance Festival. A stage is put up in the Hall for our Christmas Concert. A{Playgroup}for pre -school children is run by{my Mum}at the recently renovated Wesleyan Chapel now used as a Community Centre.
